Start accepting payments using Giropay, a favorite payment method in Germany. Giropay provides a method to make purchases online through quick and easy bank transfers that are not only secure but guaranteed.  
Giropay is available through direct integration with the Gateway API. To start accepting Giropay payments, please contact your relationship manager. 
 
Giropay payments follow a two-step process: * [API: Authorizing a Giropay payment](/docs/giropay#section--span-class-step_hl-step-1-span-api-authorizing-a-giropay-payment-) * [Redirecting the customer](/docs/giropay#section--span-class-step_hl-step-2-span-redirect-the-customer-) ## <span class="step_hl">Step 1:</span> **API: Authorizing a Giropay payment** ## The request Use the details below to set up your request. ### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://api.checkout.com/payments</p></pre> ### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="post-tag">POST</span>https://sandbox.checkout.com/payments</p></pre> ### Header parameters 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`Authorization` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`secret key`* 
`Content-Type` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`application/json` 
*For authorization, use the valid `secret key` of your Checkout.com account. You can find this in [The Hub](https://hub.checkout.com/). ### Request example 
JSON
rename · delete
12

2
  "source": {

    "type": "giropay",

 "success_url": "http://example.com/payments/success",
10
 "failure_url": "http://example.com/payments/fail",
11
}
12

If a customer ID or email is not provided in the request, then we automatically create a customer profile and return the customer `id` in the response.

Import from Gist
## <span class="step_hl">Step 2:</span> **Redirecting the customer** Redirect your customer to the `redirect` link’s href in the response to [Step 1](/docs/giropay#section-the-response). The redirect transfers the customer to their bank's website where they are required to enter their authorization details; if successful, the payment can be approved. Once completed, the customer is transferred to your predefined success or failure URL. Confirmation of a Giropay payment is communicated **only through webhooks**. When you receive a `charge.captured` webhook notification, the transaction has been completed successfully. Until the `charge.captured` webhook is received (response code 10000), all payments are labeled as *Pending*.  
Giropay **does not** currently support refunds. However, a customer's bank account information is available for you to process a refund manually once you have received the `charge.captured` webhook notification. To view a customer's banking information, you can use our retrieve payment details API below. ## The request Use the details below to set up your request. ### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://api.checkout.com/payments/{payment_id}</p></pre> ### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://sandbox.checkout.com/payments/{payment_id}</p></pre> ### Header and path parameters 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`Authorization` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`secret key`* 
*For authorization, use the valid `secret key` of your Checkout.com account. You can find this in [The Hub](https://hub.checkout.com/). 
x    
Add Row Add Col
`payment_id` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
The payment ID found in the response of the initial payment.

Import from Gist
 
If the customer cancels or fails to complete the transaction at any point after the payment is created, it will automatically be *Voided*, and we'll send you a `charge.voided` webhook. 
We provide every merchant with an endpoint that presents an up-to-date list of all banks supporting Giropay payments. ## The request Use the details below to set up your request. ### Endpoint live <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://api.checkout.com/giropay/banks</p></pre> ### Endpoint sandbox <pre class="api-header-long-url"><p class="api-header"><span class="get-tag">GET</span>https://sandbox.checkout.com/giropay/banks</p></pre> ### Header parameters 
x

`Authorization` <span class="req-def">Required</span> 
`secret key`* 
*For authorization, use the valid `secret key` of your Checkout.com account. You can find this in [The Hub](https://hub.checkout.com/). ## The response ### Example response
